sources.title: "Girl Shy" (1924) starring Harold Lloyd
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "Girl Shy" is a classic silent comedy starring Harold Lloyd.  A timid fellow must find the courage to fight for his girl when he falls in love. Directed by               Fred Newmeyer and  Sam Taylor Produced by              Harold Lloyd Scenario by                Sam Taylor, Ted Wilde, Tim Whelan           Based on                    a screen story by Thomas J. Gray Starring                     Harold Lloyd, Jobyna Ralston, Richard Daniels, Carlton Griffin Cinematography        Walter Lundin Distributed by           Pathé Exchange Release date               April 20, 1924 Running time             80 min. metadata.Plot: Harold Meadows (Lloyd) is a shy, stuttering bachelor working in a tailor shop, who is writing a guide book for other bashful young men, "The Secret of Making Love," chapters from which are portrayed as fantasy sequences. Fate has him meet rich girl, Mary (Ralston), and they fall in love. But she is about to wed an already married man, so our hero embarks upon a hair-raising daredevil ride to prevent the wedding.
